turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Some setup you got here.  A real, honest-to-goodness love nest.

turns.speaker: KIRKEBY
turns.text: Sssssh.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: You got to watch those things. Wives are getting smarter all the time.  Take Mr. Bernheim -- in the Claims Department -- came home one night with lipstick on his shirt -- told his wife he had a shrimp cocktail for lunch -- so she took it out to the lab and had it analyzed -- so now she has the house in Great Neck and the children and the new Jaguar --

turns.speaker: KIRKEBY
turns.text: Don't you ever stop talking?

turns.speaker: KIRKEBY
turns.text: Where do you live?

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: I told you -- with my mother.

turns.speaker: KIRKEBY
turns.text: Where does she live?

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: A hundred and seventy-ninth street -- the Bronx.

turns.speaker: KIRKEBY
turns.text: All right -- I'll take you to the subway.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Like hell you will.  You'll buy me a cab.

turns.speaker: KIRKEBY
turns.text: Why do all you dames have to live in the Bronx?

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: You mean you bring other girls up here?

turns.speaker: KIRKEBY
turns.text: Certainly not.  I'm a happily married man.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Yes? Oh, hello -- sure I got home all right -- you owe me forty-five cents.

turns.speaker: KIRKEBY
turns.text: Okay, okay. Look, Sylvia -- instead of Friday - could we make it Thursday night?

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Thursday? That's The Untouchables -- with Bob Stack.

turns.speaker: KIRKEBY
turns.text: Bob WHO? -- all right, so we'll watch it at the apartment. Big deal.  Baxter? It's okay for Thursday.

turns.speaker: KIRKEBY
turns.text: Stay with it, Buddy-boy!  Come on, Sylvia.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: What gives?

turns.speaker: KIRKEBY
turns.text: A little mixup in signals. Let's go.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Go where?

turns.speaker: KIRKEBY
turns.text: What's your mother doing this afternoon?

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: She's home -- stuffing a turkey.

turns.speaker: KIRKEBY
turns.text: Why don't we send her to a movie -- like Ben-Hur?

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: That's fine. But what are we going to do about grandma and Uncle Herman and Aunt Sophie and my two nieces --

turns.speaker: MISS OLSEN
turns.text: Did you have a nice Christmas?

turns.speaker: SHELDRAKE
turns.text: Lovely. You were a big help.

turns.speaker: MISS OLSEN
turns.text: Me? SHELDRAKE Thank you for giving that little pep talk to Miss Kubelik at the office party.

turns.speaker: MISS OLSEN
turns.text: I'm sorry, Jeff. You know I could never hold my liquor --

turns.speaker: SHELDRAKE
turns.text: But I thought you could hold your tongue.

turns.speaker: MISS OLSEN
turns.text: It won't happen again.

turns.speaker: SHELDRAKE
turns.text: You bet it won't. I'll arrange for you to get a month's severance pay --  That's right, Miss Olsen. I'm letting you go.

turns.speaker: MISS OLSEN
turns.text: You let me go four years ago, Jeff. Only you were cruel enough to make me sit out there and watch the new models pass by.

turns.speaker: SHELDRAKE
turns.text: I'd appreciate it if you'd be out of here as soon as you can.

turns.speaker: MISS OLSEN
turns.text: Yes, Mr. Sheldrake.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Hey, Dad -- why don't we put a fly in the nose cone and see if we can bring it back alive?

turns.speaker: SHELDRAKE
turns.text: It's a thought.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Maybe we should send up two flies -- and see if they'll propagate in orbit.

turns.speaker: SHELDRAKE
turns.text: See if they'll what?

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Propagate -- you know, multiply -- baby flies?

turns.speaker: SHELDRAKE
turns.text: Oh -- oh!

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: You came in on that boat, didn't you?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Yeah --

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: Where are you headed?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: What's it matter? Get to the point.

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: Look -- you know the girls -- Thta's Terri -- she was playmate of --

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Yeah, I caught your show at Hau Fat.

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: Oh -- I see -- Well, girls, this is Captain -- eh --

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Captain Willard -- go ahead.

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: Look -- we got in a little trouble -- they rudely took our helicopter for MedEvac work on this -- uh Operation Brute Force -- They just brought it back this morning.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: Well I mean like they also took our fuel -- We've been here two days.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Dreadful.

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: Look -- the girls could get killed -- we're not supposed to be this close combat, I mean real combat.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Well --

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: We could use some fuel -- just a half drum -- just enough to get us out a here.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: We need all our fuel.

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: Look -- you know who that is, Captain -- you know what she's saying -- you'll never see stuff that good outside of a magazine for the rest of your life.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I'm not that fond of blondes -- maybe I like brunettes --

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: Take your pick -- they all like you -- I can tell --

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I like all of them --

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: Good -- like I said, take your pick.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I said I like all of them.

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: Now just a second -- I'm doing you a favor, buddy -- what're you trying to pull?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: We need all our fuel anyway.

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: Wait -- wait -- don't get up tight -- what I meant was we'd need a whole drum for that --

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Sit down -- we'll talk about it.

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: What's there to talk about -- this whole thing disgusts me.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: My men --

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: What !

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: That's what there is to talk about -- my man -- I take a good care of my men --

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: You're out of your skull --

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: We have a lot of pride in our unit --

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: How far do you think you can push -- what kind of people do you think --

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Esprit de corps --

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: No -- absolutely not --

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: One for all -- all for one --

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: You can keep your fucking fuel --

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: You make some of your closest friends in the army -- war has a way of bringing men together.

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: Get out --

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Men of all races -- nationalities --

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: Two whole drums --

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: We can use some fifty caliber and a 16 too --

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: I don't know what you're talking about -- Get fucked --

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I will -- I assure you that -- You got a fifty on that H-34 -- leave the ammo in boxes -- I'll get my men to bring the first drum with 'em --

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: We've been attacked.

turns.speaker: AUSTRALIAN
turns.text: I know, I know, it's all right. Come in this way. It's mined over there. This way. It's all right.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Who the hell are you?

turns.speaker: AUSTRALIAN
turns.text: Moonby. Got any Winstons?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Moonby what?

turns.speaker: AUSTRALIAN
turns.text: Moonby, 4th battalion, Royal Australian Regiment, Task Force. Ex-Corporal Moonby, deserted.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: What is this?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: How about a drink ?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Sure, thanks.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Winning the war by yourself.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Part.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Which part is that ?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: My part.  Beer, with ice and water.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: That's good gin.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I'm sure it is, but I had hepatitis.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Delta ?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: North ?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Yeah. Way north.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: What unit were you with ?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: None.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Rangers, eh?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Sort of.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Were you Longe Range Recon --

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: No -- I worked too far north for LRRP.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: That's quite an array of ribbons...

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Let's talk about you.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: I was an FO for the 25th.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Tracks ?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Fat. That's real fat.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Sometimes.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: At least you always have enough water. How many gallons does each one of those damn things carry ?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Thirty -- sometimes fifty.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: You know, I can remember once, getting back below the DMZ -- and the first Americans we ran into were a track squadron. I just couldn't believe how much water they had. We'd been chewing bamboo shoots for almost a week, and before that, for two weeks, we'd been drinking anything -- rain water, river shit, stuff right out of the paddies. And there were these guys standing by their trucks spilling water all over. I could've killed them.  I swear to God I would have, too, if ...

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: I didn't know we had units up there in North Vietnam.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: We do.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: How long were you up there ?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: A long time.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: A year ? Waiter another beer.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I go up on missions. Listen Captain, buy me all the beer you want, but you better tell that asshole over there you're not going to find out anymore about me.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Headquarters 11 Corps -- 405th A.S.A Battalion -- S-2 -- Com-Sec -- Intelligence -- Nha Trang.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Who are you ?

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: It's really too much -- I mean I've collected every picture of her since she was Miss December.

turns.speaker: CLEAN
turns.text: Yeah -- you can really get hung up on them like the cat in the Delta.

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: So what happened ?

turns.speaker: CLEAN
turns.text: He was working A.R.V.N. patrols and had one a them little cocky gook asshole Lieutenants -- anyhow, the Lieutenant took his new Playboy one day, sat on the end of the dock, and wouldn't give it back.

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: Yeah -- typical A.R.V.N.

turns.speaker: CLEAN
turns.text: Then went too far -- he sat there and starts mutilating the centerfold. Poking pins in her an' all that. Sergeant says, don't do her like that. You leave your shitty little hands off that girl. Gook Lieutenant says Fuck you in Vietnamese -- Sergeant says, don't do that again. You'll wish you hadn't. Then he stood up, flicked his iron to rock and roll and gave the little zero a long burst through the Playboy mag. Man, it blew him clean off the dock -- Hell, just the magazine was floatin' there all full of holes.

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: Holy shit.

turns.speaker: CLEAN
turns.text: What did you put in all those ammo boxes?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Arch light.

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: I hate that -- Every time I hear that noise something terrible happens.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Chef.

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: Yes, sir --

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Why they call you that?

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: Call me what, sir?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Chef -- is that 'cause you like mangoes an' stuff?

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: No, sir -- I'm a real chef, sir -- I'm a sauciere --

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: A sauciere --

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: That's right, sir -- I come from New Orleans -- I was raised to be a sauciere.. a great sauciere. We specialize in sauces; my whole family. It's what we do. I was supposed to go to Paris and study at the Escoffier School; I was saving the money. They called me for my physical so I figured the Navy had better food.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: What are you doing out here?

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: Cook school -- that did it.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: They lined us all up in front of a hundred yards of prime rib -- magnificent meat, beautifully marbled.. Then they started throwing it in these big cauldrons, all of it -- boiling. I looked in, an' it was turning gray. I couldn't stand it. I went into radio school.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I've arranged with those people we saw at Hau Fat to give us some 50 caliber in trade for a couple a drums of fuel --

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: No shit.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Chef -- since you're such a fan of Miss December's I think you should be detailed with Lance and Clean to take the first drum up there.

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: I don't believe you --

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: What do you see?

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: I know it sounds stupid, but I feel like the goddamn jungle's watching us.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Probably is.

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: Whatdoya think it thinks.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: That we're dumber than we look.

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: There's some bad holes, man, and the cracks -- water's coming through the cracks. Food's shot to hell.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: How much is left?

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: Less than half -- sure is a mess down there.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: And the grass?

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: Still got a lot of that stuff from Nha Trang. But we're running low on the other.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: That's a light down there --

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: Yeah, it is.

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: Charlie?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Looks that way.

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: Who's he?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: God knows.

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: Captain -- they've been probed all this week -- Cong and NVA regulars. There's gonna be a big offense any time.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: What are we doing here?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Kurtz. I'm supposed to kill him, just like he said.

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: He killed that guy without feeling anything.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Not a thing.

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: When you kill Cong, don't you feel something.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Sure.  Recoil... I feel the recoil of my rifle.

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: This is evil -- evil, Captain. We're all gonna die here.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Yeah, I know.

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: I don't get it -- You said your mission was to kill him. Let's do it, an' get our asses outta here. This  Kurtz is ruining the war; I mean, this don't look good for America !

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: ... he's an amazing officer.

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: You got to kill this sonuvabitch -- Lance and me, we don''t understand none of this -- Jesus, Captain -- I don't wanna die here -- Do it quick.

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: Can I go get those mangos now?

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: I'll go with you in a while -- judt hold tight awhile --

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: You forgot the mangoes, didn't you?

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: Mangoes? There as a fucking tiger in the woods -- I could've been eaten alive. I'm never going into that jungle again. I gotta remember never get out of the boat; never get outta the boat.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: Elevate Lance, in the tree. No, I saw another.

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: Thirty meters up, Lance; I saw the fucking flash.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: What'd he say?

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: Said I speak French like a Spanish cow.

turns.speaker: CHEF
turns.text: Flood.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: No -- most of 'em are still standing -- might've been disease.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I met the P.B.R. crew; they were pretty much all kids, except for Phillips, the Chief -- Gunner's Mate Third Class L. Johnson -- Lance Johnson; Gunner's Mate Third Class J. Hicks -- The Chef -- Radio Operator Second Class T. Miller; they called him Mr. Clean.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Chief, try to keep out of where we're going -- Why we're goin' and what's gonna be the big surprise.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: All right with me, I used to drive a taxi.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Let's go.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: The Delta closes off to us about ten  miles out of Hau Fat. We'll be able to pick up some supplies -- bit I think there are only two points we can draw enough water to get into the Nung River. It's all Charlie's turf from there on out.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: We're gonna have some help to get in the river. You know these waters, Chief ?

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: 'Bout six months ago I took a man up to Lo Mung Bridge. He was regular Army too. Shot himself in the head. I brought his body back down.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Shot himself. What for ?

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: Beats me -- the sun was too much for him, or the mud. Who knows ?

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: Smoke !

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Where ?

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: Yeah -- fishing village -- helicopters over there. Hueys, lots of 'em.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: First Air Cavalry. They're the ones gonna get us into the River.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: We could go in tomorrow at dawn -- there's always off-shore wind in the morning.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: The draft of that river might be too shallow on the point.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: Yeah, Chef -- go ahead -- take Lance with you --

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I'll go with him --

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: Careful,  Captain, they've been known to charge.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: All right I got a little surprise for you --

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: What're you trying to say, Captain --

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: You'll see soon enough -- get going, sailor --

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: No shit -- hot damn --

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: Wow, you must a found the C.O., eh?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: We found some bodies -- let's get out a here.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: What about ducking into one of those tributaries till this river slows down?

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: Who knows what's up there?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Can't be any worse than this. What do you think?

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: I think this river wants to take us home fast. I'm practically goin' in reverse.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Well, get in there.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: This whole area is lousy with V.C. -- We don't stand a chance. Lemme turn around and we'll be in Hau Fat in six minutes.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Get in there !

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: This is my crew and my fucking boat, and I'm the responsible party.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Get in there now or I'll bury you in this river.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: What the hell is it?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: In the middle of the jungle -- a goddamn light.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: They're not Cong.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: We're Americans.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I am -- I'm Captain B.L. Willard. This is Chief Warrant Officer Phillips -- it's his boat. We were shot up bad downriver and need repairs and food -- we can pay you in gold.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Rocks, sand -- those two men who deserted.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: When'd you do it?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: While you were sleeping.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: Why -- Charlie put it there to kill --

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Thta's not Charlie's work --

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Whoever put'em there didn't do it to kill people -- They put 'em up as signs --

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: Signs?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Yeah -- like keep out --

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Listen.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Listen.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: Will they attack?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: If they have boats ... or canoes... they'd get lost in the fog. We can't move either -- we'll end up on the shore.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Two hours after the fog lifted, we moved slowly to a spot we thought was roughly a mile and a half below Kurtz's camp. We approached a long sand-bank stretching down the middle of the river.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: Which way? Right or left?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Who knows? Right.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: Looks pretty shallow.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: Anybody see some smoke ?

turns.speaker: CLEAN
turns.text: Too far inland.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: What cat  ?

turns.speaker: CLEAN
turns.text: One that went up for murder -- he was an Army Sergeant.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: I never heard about that.

turns.speaker: CLEAN
turns.text: Yeah -- he really dug his Playboy mag, man -- I mean like he was there when it arrived -- He just knew.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: They nail him for it bad ?

turns.speaker: CLEAN
turns.text: He's in the L.B.J. -- didn't give him no medals or nothing --

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: Forget that extra drum -- it's too damn hot.

turns.speaker: CLEAN
turns.text: Clear on starboard -- Where's Lance an' the Captain?

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: I saw that Colonel's Huey on the point --

turns.speaker: CLEAN
turns.text: Jesus -- that guy's too damn much.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: I wonder if that was the same copter.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: What do you want ?

turns.speaker: CIVILIAN
turns.text: If you're B.L. Willard, 4th Recon Group, we'd like you to come with us.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Whose orders ?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I only met Kurtz once.

turns.speaker: CIVILIAN
turns.text: Would he remember you ?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Maybe.

turns.speaker: CIVILIAN
turns.text: You didn't like him.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Anyone got a cigarette.

turns.speaker: CIVILIAN
turns.text: What does that mean ?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Maybe it's not Kurtz. I don't believe he's capable of that. I just don't believe it.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Our Recon flight ?

turns.speaker: CIVILIAN
turns.text: Ours.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Touchy.

turns.speaker: CIVILIAN
turns.text: You can see, of course, the implications, if any of this -- even rumours leaked out.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: You want me to clean it up -- simple and quiet.

turns.speaker: CIVILIAN
turns.text: Exactly -- you'll go up the Nung River in a Navy P.B.R. -- appear at Nu Mung Ba as if by accident, re-establish your acquintance with Colonel Kurtz, find out what's happened -- and why. Then terminate his command.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Terminate ?

turns.speaker: CIVILIAN
turns.text: Terminate with extreme prejudice.

turns.speaker: SOLDIER
turns.text: Hey, buddy, that boat still runs, eh?

turns.speaker: CLEAN
turns.text: Yeah, it still runs.

turns.speaker: SOLDIER
turns.text: Do me a favor buddy, please.

turns.speaker: CLEAN
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: SOLDIER
turns.text: It's to everyone I really knew -- the first girl I screwed -- my brother -- best friend -- I wanted to tell 'em how much I enjoyed knowing 'em -- it's been a great twenty years. I gotta let 'em know.

turns.speaker: CLEAN
turns.text: What're you askin' me for -- put 'em in the first helicopter comes in tomorrow.

turns.speaker: SOLDIER
turns.text: Nobody comes in here.

turns.speaker: SOLDIER
turns.text: You got a chance in that boat -- by morning you could be five miles down the river.

turns.speaker: CLEAN
turns.text: We ain't goin' down the river.

turns.speaker: SOLDIER
turns.text: Spooky.

turns.speaker: CLEAN
turns.text: Charlie?

turns.speaker: SOLDIER
turns.text: No, it'd be spooky without the war -- give 'em back.

turns.speaker: COLBY
turns.text: What -- happened here.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Charlie?

turns.speaker: COLBY
turns.text: NVA regulars. They're coming again tonight. Tet -- their big -- assault.

turns.speaker: COLBY
turns.text: Who is he?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: He was the tragedy -- the tragedy of this war.

turns.speaker: COLBY
turns.text: How did they know?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: They must have seen the fire.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: COLBY
turns.text: Colonel Kurtz, he's dead.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Captain B.L. Willard, G-4 Headquarters, reporting as ordered, sir.

turns.speaker: COLONEL
turns.text: Okay, Willard, sit down.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: No, sir.

turns.speaker: COLONEL
turns.text: This gentleman or myself ?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: No, sir.

turns.speaker: COLONEL
turns.text: I believe on your last job you executed a tax collector in Kontum, is that right ?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I am not presently disposed to discuss that, sir.

turns.speaker: COLONEL
turns.text: You know much about about Special Forces; Green Berets, Captain ?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I've worked with them on occasions and I saw the movie , sir.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: COLONEL
turns.text: He's commanding the detachment at Nu Mung Ba.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I thought he was a lame.

turns.speaker: COLONEL
turns.text: A lame ?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: This is years ago, before he joined Special Forces, I guess. We had an argument.

turns.speaker: COLONEL
turns.text: About what ?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I don't know. He was a lame, that's all.

turns.speaker: COLONEL
turns.text: But why ?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: He couldn't get through a sentence without all these big words; about why we kill.

turns.speaker: COLONEL
turns.text: Well, he's killing now.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Maybe.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Fifty calibers, eh, Captain --

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: As I said, we can pay you in gold.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Entirely unnecessary, Captain.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: American weapons?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: We took them from the dead.  Now -- I assume you want to rest, to shower. We'll attend to your repairs after dinner.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: We don't want to bother you any, we --

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: A man of war is never bothered to aid an ally -- you will follow me, Captain.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: A habit of men of war, sir -- you understand.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Of course, Captain -- an unfortunate necessity.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: It is very good -- there is no current -- It is very good. I have never seen one like it in all Indochina. I was in Paris when it arrived -- do you know what might have caused --

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Looks like a two thousand pound to me. Yeah, a two thousand pound bomb.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: No, I've seen those in Normandy. This is much better.  My country -- my country could never originate this. Magnificent.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Attacks repulsed, as I was saying.  This is only  for this war, Captain. Viet Cong -- 54; North Vietnamese regular forces -- 15; South Vietnamese -- 28 -- regular forces and otherwise.  Americain -- 6. Of course, they were, perhaps, mistakes, Captain.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Of course. I -- Once we make our repairs, we could send word, we could have you evacuated from here.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Captain?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: You'll get blown outta here some day.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: We will never 'evacuate', Captain -- this is our home. Indochina is ours; it has been so for a hundred and twenty-one years, there is something to say for that.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: The Vietnamese think it's theirs -- I guess the Americans do, too.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: But we civilized it. A place belongs to those who bring light to it, don't you agree.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I always thought the French came here to get the rubber.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Upriver? Why upriver? There is nothing there, only jungle.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Do you know that jungle?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: When I was a boy, my father would take me there, to hunt. There are a few savages, but no man can live there, no white man.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: What about an American named Kurtz?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Two of my men deserted last night. It happens from time to time. I assume my daughter told you of our conditions.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Your daughter.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I guess this is whAt men of war do -- eh?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: We endure, captain -- you can blow up the house and we will live in the cellar -- destroy that and we'll dig a hole in the jungle and sleep on it. Burn the forest and we'll hide in the swamp. all the while, we do but one thing -- clean the blood off our bayonets.  Au revoir, Captain.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: What's your name, sailor ?

turns.speaker: LANCE
turns.text: Gunner's Mate, Third Class -- L. Johnson, sir.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: Lance Johnson? The surfer?

turns.speaker: LANCE
turns.text: That's right, sir.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: It's an honor to meet you Lance. I've admired your nose-riding for years -- I like your cutback, too. I think you have the best cutback there is.

turns.speaker: LANCE
turns.text: Thank you, sir.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: You can cut out the sir, Lance -- I'm Bill kilgore -- I'm a goofy foot.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: Where've you been riding, Lance?

turns.speaker: LANCE
turns.text: I haven't surfed since I got here.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: That's terrible -- we'll change that -- I'd like to see you work -- I've always liked your cutback; got a hell of a left turn, too.
